programme.title: History Uncovered
programme.sub-title: The subprime crisis has gone down in history as an American disaster, but the shockwave hit Europe hard too, triggering the worst recession in its history and jeopardising its union.
programme.desc: Through an exploration of great myths, this series revisits the key moments of the 20th century with a new perspective in order to provide a new, smarter, and more subtle interpretation.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: The Allies succeed in crossing the Rhine and fight their way through Germany as the Red Army finally forces Axis troops from Soviet territory and closes on the capital, Berlin.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.sub-title: The Barnbow shell factory produced well over half a million tonnes of explosives in just four years - we show how the war factories of WWI paved the way for the modern world.
programme.desc: No matter how many soldiers you have, how clever your generals or how daring your strategy, you will not win a war if you dont have enough bullets, planes, or food. WW2 was a war of the factories...

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: July 1944: American forces plan a major offensive named Operation Cobra. They would attack near St Lo, achieve a breakthrough, then unleash General Patton and the US Third Army to exploit the opening.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: During WWI, men had to endure combat and extreme conditions; civilians dealt with food shortages and raids. The insidiousness of ethnic cleansing raised its head, and a young Adolf Hitler took note.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: History Uncovered
programme.sub-title: Who instigated the Cold War? We investigate the misunderstandings, false impressions and President Trumans anti-Communism that tipped the world into decades of belligerent peace and nuclear dissuasion.
programme.desc: Through an exploration of great myths, this series revisits the key moments of the 20th century with a new perspective in order to provide a new, smarter, and more subtle interpretation.

programme.title: History Uncovered
programme.sub-title: The subprime crisis has gone down in history as an American disaster, but the shockwave hit Europe hard too, triggering the worst recession in its history and jeopardising its union.
programme.desc: Through an exploration of great myths, this series revisits the key moments of the 20th century with a new perspective in order to provide a new, smarter, and more subtle interpretation.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Great Pyramid at Giza in Egypt is a wonder of the world, but when was it built, for what purpose, and by who, and what can the earliest pyramid of Djoser at Saqqara add to the argument?
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: J. Paul Getty was renowned for his wealth and frugality as well as his lack of empathy and compassion for his family. He would marry four times and sire five sons, but he died old and alone.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: Many historians believe that the Biblical Moses actually existed - could Mosess intriguing similarities to the pharaoh Akhenaten be more than just a coincidence?
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.sub-title: The Barnbow shell factory produced well over half a million tonnes of explosives in just four years - we show how the war factories of WWI paved the way for the modern world.
programme.desc: No matter how many soldiers you have, how clever your generals or how daring your strategy, you will not win a war if you dont have enough bullets, planes, or food. WW2 was a war of the factories...

programme.title: Normandy: Land of Warriors
programme.sub-title: Normandy owes its name to terrible warriors coming from the North: the Vikings. These men ravaged the Norman lands until it was ceded to them and became their territory.
programme.desc: From the Viking invasions to the great sieges of Richard the Lionheart, the history of the Dukes of Normandy is an incredible military epic spanning more than 300 years.

programme.title: Revolutions That Changed History
programme.sub-title: Taxed without representation, American colonists rebelled and formed a new government; leaders like Washington and Adams rallied militias and a victory in Boston fuelled their quest for independence.
programme.desc: This series exposes the truth behind ancient revolutions and revolts, from action-packed bloody battlegrounds to the intimate exchanges between confidants that were powerful enough to turn tides.

programme.title: Reinventing China
programme.sub-title: China faced a Japanese invasion during WWII; far from being defeated, the country found ways to rise again. Discover how China became the second-biggest economic and third military power in the world.
programme.desc: Discover the evolution of modern China through 150 years of history and key figures; the country lost its position of leadership but soon bounced back to become the most powerful country in the world.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: Berlin falls and the war in Europe ends. Okinawa falls with terrible losses on both sides as each prepares for the invasion of the first of the major home islands - but a new weapon is unleashed.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.sub-title: The Spitfire, the Hurricane, the Lancaster and Wellington bombers - aircraft which arguably won the Battle of Britain - had one thing in common: they were powered by the Rolls-Royce Merlin engine.
programme.desc: No matter how many soldiers you have, how clever your generals or how daring your strategy, you will not win a war if you dont have enough bullets, planes, or food. WW2 was a war of the factories...

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: September 1944: Montgomery proposes a bold plan to cross the Rhine and encircle Germanys industrial heartland. If successful, his plan could end the war by Christmas.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: Stalin rises as the leader of the Bolsheviks, and in Munich, the German Workers Party takes a new name: Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiter, or Nazi as it would come to be called.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: Who Wrote the Bible?
programme.desc: In an exciting archaeological and scientific investigation, we meet the most eminent specialists in the Bible to try to answer one fundamental question: who wrote the Holy Book?

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: Archaeologists discovery of King Tuts tomb taught us about a lost civilisation. When death befell several members of the team, rumours of a curse on the tomb spread like wildfire around the world.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: A team of experts investigate the methods Hitler used to indoctrinate Germany, turning it into a finely-tuned war machine; we visit Goebbels Propaganda Ministry and the holiday park of Prora.
